title: Was counterfeiting a big problem when China invented paper money? - Quora

response.answer_text: In short: yes. Jiaozi, which was invented in Song Dynasty (690–1279), is believed to be the world's earliest paper money. When a lot of paper money printed out and circulated through the society in a large scale, the Song government realized the seriousness of counterfeiting. They even founded a specialized government department to issue, print, authorize cash, and handle with those fake banknotes and fake money, especially those fake paper ones.[1] So it’s pretty safe to say that counterfeiting was a big problem at that time. The Song government invented several ways to combat counterfeiting: Guard the wood used to make the money to control access to the paperPrint sophisticacted patternsStamp special government seal on every paper moneyFootnotes[1] Banknote seal (China)
